results.title: Home, the old place, Little Dunmore
results.creator_credit: Eileen Alberts, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eileen Alberts remembers the home of her past, her family’s history and her spiritual home. It is the place that has made her the person she is and where she returns to soothe her soul and strengthen her spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eileen Alberts, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Good evil deeds
results.brief_description:
Good Evil Deeds (GED) is a short interactive Macromedia Flash animation about a young woman Audrey who’s doomed to an early death. Choices made in GED will send Audrey to one of three places in the afterlife: Hell, Purgatory or Heaven.
Inspired by the French film “Amelie”.

results.title: Duck
results.brief_description: Four lucky ducks escape death from hunters when a lonely man takes them into his home and his life. A claymation tale set to original music written by Ollie Brown. Animation by Jesse van den Dungen.

results.title: Early promos 2002: Kalleido screen
results.brief_description: Contains three short promotional works played on the Kalleido screen in 2002. Includes: Small town cowboys; Get into dragons; ACMI Kids in space.

results.title: Home country
results.creator_credit: Julie Mongta-Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Julie Mongta/Saunders traces the movement of her family over time, both geographically and generationally. Though scattered, this family have a strong connection, both to each other and the land of their birth, intensified by the sense of ‘coming home’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julie Mongta-Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Toil and trouble
results.brief_description: When the warehouse boss lowers the overheads, Bronwen fights back and earns a black belt in Industrial Relations. Produced in the style of the silent era, and performed in mime, this short story also contains a social political message of today’s IR laws in Australia. Music soundtrack with English intertitles. Music by Donna Coleman (pianist), Disasteradio and The Raskolnikovs. Warning: contains coarse language.

results.title: A Life in the day of a cycle courier
results.brief_description: Sarah’s a cycle courier chasing the money, but at what price? Short and succinct this quirky little tale bounces along to the tune of “I Quite Like Girls on Bikes” written and performed by Urban Tramper and His Pack. Features Paige Anderson as girl on bike.

results.title: Our peninsula
results.brief_description: A personal narrative by Jenny Macaffer about her family’s relationship with the Mornington Peninsula over three generations using photographic images and computer animation. Pipe music performed by the Rats of Tobruk Memorial Highland Band 1984.

results.title: World Without End [Exhibition Trailer]
results.brief_description: Trailer for the ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition running from 13 April to 17 July 2005. Starting with the commissioned installation “History of a Day” WWE presents the subtle and dramatic forces of nature, the energies and rhythms of cities and the elastic time of global travel and communiication networks.
